review_content:

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: The food here is good (but not great). The Korean Fried Broccoli was a bit too spicy for me, and felt like an apetizer from a cheap Korean resturant. Other dishes where nice and the servise was exelant (the staff earned the forth star).

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
I will start off by saying that if you are picky and boring with food, you won't like this place. Haha. The menu is very innovative and cool - every dish is based around a specific vegetable. It's also done kind of tapas style - small plates to share. They recommend two plates per person but we like food so...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Forget Michelin stars, this place has amazing food which is prepared with great intricacies. The food doesn't only taste amazing but the presentation is fantastic.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Did the chefs choice menu which they had as a special at their grand str location. Great culinary craftsmanship, interesting ideas, flavour accords of 4-6 notes with each one sounding distinctly. Deserts are smart and tasty. Great calm atmosphere. Perfect night out dinner.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Outstanding vegetarian cuisine that is created with a specific vision and purpose in mind. It isn't pretentious, but rather creative and familiar, broccoli hotdogs Anyone? Which btw were totally outstanding, you won't wanna ever eat plain broccoli again. The desserts are very noteworthy and are an absolute must. Decor and setting is lovely and appropriate, friendly and helpful service is...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Wow! What a great experience. Great food and fantastic staff. ZERO pretense. Everyone makes you feel welcome and appreciated. Would recommend chef's sampler for newbies to the restaurant and sit at the bar. You won't regret it. Thank you for a wonderful night.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:

review_content:
Basically we fell into this restaurant by accident. We were in the area and googled restaurants and this came up so we decided to try it. We walked in and were able to be seated at the bar. restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
My title says it all. This is not your normal Vegetarian restaurant. The menu is small but each dish is so different from each other it gives the menu a bigger feeling. The staff was great and had a great knowledge of each dish which was great! The only downside is the price is high but that's normal in New...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: A great find, lovely vegetarian food.
review_content:
I had booked the restaurant for lunch after reading about it in some online publication which listed the supposed best vegetarian restaurants in NY city. The restaurant was a very good surprise indeed, with original and very tasty creations. Only vegetarian/vegan options obviously but even my wife (who eats meat) remarked that the food was very tasty and that she...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Great vegetarian - vegan brunch spot. Bright and airy. Not too cramped. Everything on the brunch menu except one egg dish comes in a vegan version, pastries included. The cocktails are really creative and refreshing. Come hungry as the food is very filling and the portions are generous. The service is very attentive and they've adopted the "service fee included"...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: Surprising and exciting vegetarian, and no tipping!
review_content:
Dirt Candy serves innovative and creative vegetable dishes applying techniques and flavours from various cuisines to come up with unusual combinations and textures. Presentation was precise and beautiful. Service was super helpful, friendly and efficient. We opted for the tasting menu at $75 a head, and it was really worth it. Because the dishes are unusual and surprising, it could...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: Who needs meat when food tastes this good?!
review_content:
Bringing a veggie to NYC with us, I thought it would be nice to check this restaurant out. We were not disappointed! Really tasty, inventive food and cocktails - we loved the korean fried broccoli and the carrot sliders. The staff were very attentive and obviously seemed really enthusiastic about the offerings. Would love to go back if I return...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Excellent. Start to finish. I walked in so excited to be there, as I had wanted to try it for so long. We made it happen for my birthday dinner and it was worth the trip to NYC to try it. We were welcomed by excellent staff who took care of us from arrival to departure. The menu itself, the...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
This is a unique experience and all of the reviews are spot on. Dirt Candy is one of the best restaurants we have been at. All of the dishes are unique and full of flavour. Hence, we opted for the tasting menu and each course was amazing. We especially enjoyed the Jalapeño Hushpuppies and the Korean fried broccoli- especially if...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: I'm far from a vegetarian, and this was great
review_content: Had dinner here after visiting the Tenement Museum, which is just around the corner on Allen Street. Overall the food was fantastic. The only dish we weren't totally impressed by was the Brussels sprout tacos. Would definitely come back again to try some of the items we didn't have the chance to sample this time.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
This is my new favorite vegetarian in town! First, the place is beautiful and well decorated. Second, the service is probably the best I've had in years in the city. The waiters are patient and walk you through the whole menu. And third, and most importantly, the food is fantastic and innovative. In a city that is still not known...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: holy moly this is dam good food
review_content:
I challenge a meat eater to miss or even care they are not eating flesh. Awesome and trust me im not a "hippy veggie". Elegant, modern, tasty tasty food. Impressive and exciting. It is one of those places where each dish tops the previous dish and you have no idea which one was your favorite of the night. Clever people....
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Before I head left England I read reviews on DC and decided I had to go. Booked the restaurant online in England and waited in antipation. The food was incredible. I've always been a vegetarian and love the vibe of vegetarian restaurants. Even my boyfriend left impressed by the options. We ordered 5 options including tacos, korean broccoli, tomato and...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Four years ago a friend who once lived in NYC told me that DC was one of her favorite restaurants so I put it on my list of places to go when in NYC. After four years of anticipation I was excepting to have set the bar to high and be somewhat disappointed. We were blown away by the food...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: We rocked up here nearly an hour late after arriving from the UK and the staff were more than happy to honour our reservation and did not seem phased. Food was presented as colourful and appetising small plates, and each was delicious. Will go back on our next trip to NYC

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Had dinner with friends at Dirt Candy and was just blown away by it. I swear you would not even think you were just eating vegetables. The flavors and variety were fantastic. We had the carrot sliders, Korean fried broccoli, hush puppies, Brussels sprouts tacos, the zucchini, and the cauliflower. All were amazing. Cocktails were delicious and they actually gave...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: FINALLY got a reservation for brunch on what turned out to be the hottest day of the year. The food is inventive and unique. Chocolaye and onion pastry?? Delicious! The spucy tofu sandwich was yummy. Cucumber ice cream sundae? Of couse! I hope to secure a dinner reservation sometime...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
This restaurant exceeded our expectations in every way. First, the food. Delicious does not begin to describe the flavors we experienced here. The food is served in small plates so we ordered a variety of items to share. Korean Fried Broccoli - Amazing!, Jalapeño Hush Puppies - Delish!, Carrot Sliders - Also Amazing! (Order more than one serving) , Brussels...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
This is a fantastic restaurant for many reasons, but mainly because it manages to be 3 things that you hardly ever see combined: devoted vegetarian, truly original, and exceptionally good. Also, they have done away with the whole backward and degrading tipping thing, and simply pay their staff fair wages. And with good results. Service was by far the best...

review_title: One of the best vegetarian restaurants on the East Coast
review_content:
Thrilling is a mild word to describe the culinary delights that this restaurant has for both vegetarians and nonvegetarians alike. With excellent fare and no tipping allowed, this restaurant is quick to fill up so make sure to get a reservation early. The unique cocktails are more inventive than they are bingeworthy but the food is a different story. I...

We grabbed a seat at the bar because we didn't have reservations and it was booked for the night. Best decision we've made on a restaurant in a long time. The food was just overwhelmingly delicious. review_content:
As a vegetarian when visiting a new place I usually try to visit a veggie restaurant. Dirt Candy though was something else... Delicious, thoughtful and creative food presented spectacularly. review_content:

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Beautiful presentation. Dirt Candy elevates vegetables into art. The flavors are creative combinations that give the tastebuds unexpected delights. Great service, no tipping allowed.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: The dishes are very nicely designed! Great vegetarian food with twix. The layered omelette with goat cheese was amazing! Overall great food with great environment! A busy place! Very friendly service ! Highly recommended!

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
My husband gave a concert in this area and we wanted to have a bite afterwards and were looking for a vegan restaurant.....we stumbled upon Dirt Candy. What a unique experience! The waiters were friendly and passionate about explaining the dishes. We had the carrot sliders..no point in trying to explain...you have to try them for yourselves! A delicate Foragers...

review_content:
Our party of six went to Dirt Candy this past Saturday and had the most delicious, amazing meal of our lives. Since there was six in the party, we had the pre-fixed meal where they brought out dish after dish after dish after dish of the most delectable food. review_title: Dirt Candy - so Sweet and Clean!
review_content:
Visiting New York we love to check out the best vegan dining spots. Dirt Candy has been on our list and we were so looking forward to going there. IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT! restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
My husband and I were in the city and sort of stumbled on Dirt Candy. We were very happy that we did. It is a tapas style and we loved the jalepeno corn fritters and the carrot sliders the best and enjoyed the broccoli dogs as well. The portions are a bit on the small side and it is pricy...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: My family ate lunch here and it was wonderful. Every dish was a 10 out of 10! I can't wait to go back. I believe the menu changes often so it will be interesting to see what they do next. Good service and good atmosphere.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Had been for breakfast so expected a lot especially having to weeks for early reservation. Sad to say of the four offerings sampled only two were outstanding especially the cauliflower curry . restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
My new favorite vegetarian place! Love love love! It's hard to get a reservation I feel so book in advance. I did however come here as a walk-in and got a table fairly easily with a time constraint. Points to make: The food is creative and delicious Great wine Manager was helpful and friendly Staff was friendly When we arrived...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
If you are a vegetarian, you will probably like this quirky little restaurant. But I thought it was a quite expensive for vegetables. My friend and I shared a Foragers Salad (which was okay) a broccoli dog (a stalk of broccoli on a hot dog bun-$16) the Eggplant dish ($18) and hushpuppies. Three cocktails, tax and the administrative fee brought...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Enjoyable vegetarian restaurant. Casual, not fancy. Enjoyed Korean broccoli, hush puppies, carrot sliders and Brussel spout tacos. Tapas style allows time and quantity to try many items. not expensive. Wish they had better wine options.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Nice setting, friendly professional service, creative food. But we did not like several of our dishes. Jalapeno Hush Puppy was so hot, it burned our tongues. The Korean Fried Broccoli, a lot of diners' favorite, while tasty, was too strong with nothing accompanying it. Would have been better if it was over farro, noodles, or brown rice. Potato salad was...
More

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: A non vegetarian will enjoy Dirt Candy. Great food that is a little pricey but worth it. The staff is super and if you sit at the counter you can talk to some of the cooks and preparers.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: One of the most creative and delicious meals I've had! I'm a big foodie and this place did not disappoint. We ordered two appi's and four main dishes all to share (two of us were dining). Everything was flavourful and presentation was perfect! Great selection of drinks to go with. Will be back again.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
Vegetable restaurant. Almost everything can be vegan. Best vegan food ever tried. We only managed a reservation at 10:30 pm but it was worth it. The food is light and small so you can try many different dishes and be amazed. Many natural wines and a good reccomendation by the waiter. Wonderfull vegan dessert. Funny and informative and wysmical cook...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
I found this restaurant whilst researching vegetarian restaurants in NYC for my friends 40th birthday. This is far more than a restaurant, it is a dining experience. I regularly review eating places and this has to be one of, if not the best (and I am not actually vegetarian). The premises are perfect and the hosts are totally committed to...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
I understand the desire to offer vegetarians something far more sophisticated than a steamed vegetable platter, but the menu here is narrow, quite pretentious and unappealing, and the food tastes far worse than it looks too much of the time. Why does a chocolate dessert have to have "onion jam" embedded in it? Why must the ice cream be corn-flavored?...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: More Eye Candy Than Stomach Candy
review_content:
I regret to say that, after waiting a long time with great anticipation, this restaurant let us down. Much more eye candy than stomach candy. And a lot of pretentiousness. Some specifics: Giving guests only a drink menu and no food menu when they sit down is presumptuous and coercive. A modest wineglass of cider for $13 looked ridiculously expensive...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: This restaurant was so innovative that it is beyond your imagination.Of course the food was delicious but I was eating vegetarian dishes unlike anything I had ever eaten. There were reminders of other foods e.g. broccoli based hot dogs but they were tasty and a new experience.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
My partner is a vegetarian and I love a good veggie meal so when we were planning a trip to New York I made sure we got a reservation at Dirt Candy. After seeing the chef on Iron Chef and reading many reviews I was pretty excited and believe me the restaurant did not disappoint. We love the small plate...

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Innovative as is delicious. The vegetarian food here is meant to be shared and stared at-beautiful presentation & interesting takes on familiar ideas-the curry fries resemble poutine-great broccoli-even the desserts are born of vegetables-reservations needed-brunch served too-pricing includes tips.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: Food is good but I am a little put off by the faux need to have a reservation
review_content:

And in fact we were given a table both times without a reservation. The second time, we were invited to eat but admonished to...

review_title: Awesome, and almost all menu vegan alternatives
review_content:
Great staff, awesome food and like the vibe. Relaxed but professional, food prepared with a lot of love and taste fantastic. Party of 4 with 2 teenagers, and we all live the food - 8 dishes and the only one not 100% being the eggplant (too heavy/spivey for our taste). Mushroom, carrot and broccoli picked as favourites. restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: a super trendy vegetarian restaurant in the lower east side. Imaginative veggie dishes. Great service!!! specious decor, nice place to sit at. Go for it!

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: Interesting delicious and exciting vegi food

We walked here for lunch after visiting the 911 memorial having read reviews on trip advisor. So glad we did! This place is amazing. The food was so good and different yet still proper food not that weird wheat pretend meat stuff they serve up elsewhere! It is imaginative and so so tasty. Even my meat eating other half loved...

review_content: The chef at Dirt Candy definitely "cooks with love" and each dish will change your perception of vegetables, especially the squash biscuits which are absolutely amazing. The only negatives are the location (street parking is impossible in Chinatown) and how tough it has become to secure a reservation.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:
This was my second time visiting this restaurant this year. I am not vegetarian and this makes me think I could be. The food is delicious. The decor is lovely. restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Wonderful meal in Chinatown area of NYC- very interesting and sometimes a bit funky menu items- bread in a clay pot- broccoli hot dogs- the MUSHROOM entree was wonderful, umami I believe would be the word- A bit noisy, but very wonderful service- and can't wait to return--

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: Beat place to eat as veg/vegan
review_content: OK so... I really only have good things to say. Amazing food, place, people, concept, space, heck even the owner checked in on us. Amazing experience over all. Veg friendliness 10/10

review_content:

review_content: Based on reviews, I was expecting something great. What I got was interesting, but not very delicious, and definitely not worth the money. The waiter kept pressuring us to order at least 5 items, which was annoying.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:

review_content: I went here for dinner and was very pleased with the service and the food. The wait staff were friendly and helpful with ordering and the food was amazing. The dishes were delicious, creative and beautifully presented. I would recommend this restaurant to vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike without hesitation.

review_title: Vegetarian but not as we know it!

review_title: Not just for vegetarians: a fun, creative food experience with a wonderfully friendly staff
review_content: Excellent food, great vibe, and a great staff. It is an experience both for NYC natives and visitors to the city.

review_content: Amanda the Chef is genius. Wonderful and creative vegetarian adventure. The creations blew my mind - fun and fresh and interesting.

review_content: Even the non vegetarians loved the meal. Impossible to describe - beets, broccoli carrots reinvented into something amazing. Typically I hate creative food, but everything was delicious.

review_content: This is a really fun vegetarian restaurant. We loved the food but came away still hungry. The vegetarian food is well-presented and fun. There's a good vibe in the restaurant and it was busy.

review_content: Whether you're a vegetarian or not, this place is wonderful. The atmosphere is a combination of downtown hip, young upscale, and fun. The food is wonderful, and very creative. And the staff couldn't be nicer. Go here for great food and fun atmosphere in a great part of downtown.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Here with a friend for an early dinner before the theater. Great cocktails and wine list - reasonable prices. Love the Korean fried broccoli - hot, interesting and satisfying! We shared the brussel sprouts tacos - what a fabulous idea and really tasty - loved all of the different fixings that came with it. Well trained and very knowledgeable waitstaff.

review_title: Twice as good as last time!
review_content: This was my second visit and it was even better. The new location is gorgeous and comfortable. The menu has been expanded and I can't wait to try everything. This time we had the tacos (amazing) the fried broccoli (to die for) and the ice cream salad (unusual but delicious). Service was spot on.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014

review_content: I loved the place. Food was really good. Atmosphere was nice. I was really excited to go there ..and it met my expectations. One advice though...if u can reserve a seat on the side where there are only 3 tables vs. The other side which has five and pretty close together. Enjoy.

review_content:

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Some of the best vegan food I've ever tried. Everything my boyfriend and I tried was amazing - the standout was the vegan ice cream nanaimo bar, though. Wish I lived in NYC so I could try the food here again soon!

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: A nice, small, focused restaurant, and great service. Appetizers and mains were quite good. My only niggles are that the hush puppies were not all that extraordinary - I would save the space for another appetizer - and the desserts were over-sweet.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: My husband and I love every single thing about Dirt Candy. From the amazing snack and starters, to the super-filling entrees. Two words: Broccoli. Dogs. We love vegan food in general, but Dirt Candy is on another level. Eat here!

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_title: Unique Vegetarian Food Made with Seasonal Produce!

review_content: This restaurant has average vegetarian food. We did have two stellar dishes, though; the mushroom pate, and the ice cream bar. We were very underwhelmed by it overall.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content:

I understand that the menu changes regularly, so these options may not be available anymore. We had the...

review_title: Food for vegetarian or vegan or any foodie for that matter!,,

review_content: This small veggie restaurant had a number of good choices which were inspired in design but let down slightly in taste. review_content: Truly inpressed! Fun, delicious, original. inspiring dishes. Food was lovely, service great. The menu is not extensive, but you want to order everything on it! Tiny restaurant, do book as they don't have a bar or 'waiting area'.

review_content: One of THE BEST dinners I have ever had. The portabello mushroom mouse was unbelievable. My wife made reservations almost 2 months in advance. So glad she did. (Restaurant has 18 seats). If you have a chance to eat here you must!!

review_content: This place has some of the most interesting food but it is not comfort food. Try as many things as you can! Also, many of the dishes have a very strong smoky flavor -which isn't necessarily a bad thing, just be aware. Get the rosemary cotton candy and eggplant tiramisu for dessert!

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014

review_content: Very difficult to get a reservation. We walked in and were seated but felt quite rushed. The food was well-prepared and interesting but not as flavorful as I had anticipated. With that to say,it was quite good and I would return.

review_content: This is haute cuisine vegetarian -- each dish thoughtfully constructed, creative and high quality. I'd like to go back and try one of everything. Just make sure to make a reservation because the place is tiny.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Dirt Candy is a fantastic restaurant. Delicious, creative food in a charming atmosphere.

review_content: I think I had high hopes for this place which is why I was a little disappointed. It was good, but nothing amazing. The portions were a little small for my liking but the flavor was good. They did have some creative veggie dishes but I'm not craving to eat any of them again.

restaurant_address: 86 Allen St, New York City, NY 10002-3014
review_content: Love this place... the menu is amazing, simple yet impressive. Vegetables never tasted this good; vegan options available. Desserts are a bliss!

review_content: With all of the hype, I was expecting to be impressed. It was strange that the chef/owner was behind the counter and kind of jumping into our conversation without saying hello or formally coming over. Small, flavorless portions.

Try the Jalapeno Hush Puppies to start, a first course of Portobello Mousse, Crispy Tofu with green ragout and finish with Popcorn pudding. Small, well chosen wine list. Chef Amanda Cohen is inspired.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

review_content: I had a great meal at morons, friendly and helpful staff. The seafood was excellent as was the steak. Wonderful flavour and very well cooked. Sides a re good, mac & Cheese was a little runny for my liking but I'm just being a bit picky.

review_content: Just a short distance from Columbus Circle (there are many locations, however, throughout NYC) with an excellent hot bar, nice dining area upstairs, and clean rest rooms. My grocery store of choice when visiting NYC.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Excellent food at very reasonable prices
review_content: The place is a self-service cafeteria with a great variety of choices. The salad/food bar has lots of cold and hot items at $7.99/LB. Soup is by the bawl, 3-4 varieties changing daily. Excellent bottled beer selection. Excellent deli and prepackaged food section. You can either carry out, or eat on the second floor, where microwave is available.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great GoTo for a quick meal or supplies for your hotel room!
review_content: Morton Williams Marketplace is a two level grocery/households store which includes a full, all-day hot buffet and cold deli. You can load up a plate and reheat it upstairs in the cafe, or take it back to your hotel. The food is delicious and there is lots of choice. The staff is wonderful!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Fave stop in NYC when at The Viceroy

When you have been walking all day, your legs hurt and you don't have the stamina to go look for someplace good to eat, go to Morton Williams before 8PM and you'll have cold and hot dishes, salads, deserts, fruit and vegetables and if you don't feel like a whole meal choose a sandwich among a great variety of ingredients....

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: excellent choices on buffet plus we tended to pickup prepackaged lunches for visits to zoo & Central Park. We also purchased breakfast at the bakery which were good & fresh. Open 24 hours !

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: The Best Find of our Visit.
review_content: Wow! This place has everything and more. We used the store multiple times from our stay at the Salisbury. If you can't find a food item here - you don't need it. Matza ball Soup - great. Breakfast to go. Cheesecake is like Lindy's. Fast and helpful checkout. Fantastic!!!!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: We ate here several times because it was convenient to our hotel. It was economical for breakfast and had a great variety of other food items. This place is very clean and well kept.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:
Standard grocery store, great location for those staying in nearby hotels. Nice touch was the buffet style area where for $8 per pound you fill up your container on whatever hot or cold items you like. Picked some chicken, salmon, rice, etc made a nice hot meal to take back to the hotel, and six pack too. You can eat...
More

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: This is a full service grocery store that also offers a hot bar, fresh baked goods, an excellent selection of cheeses along with beer and wine. There is a seating area upstairs to eat or relax, enjoy your food/drinks and utilize their free wifi.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: This place is great it was right across the road from the Salisbury we got our breakfast from here most mornings good value for money.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:
I live in the area and frequent this grocery store. In general the staff is very helpful and friendly given the high volume this store gets. I find that that the layout and the way the items are organized throughout the store is very counter intuitive and it can be a frustrating shopping experience if you need a lot of...
More

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Lots of stuff for the tourists
review_content: We stayed across the street at the Salisbury hotel and got a lot of staff from here. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, coffee. A bit overpriced, but it is Manhattan and they know how to get your money.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Standard grocery store for New York
review_content: Came here to buy groceries after work. They are a little expensive so come with a plan and shopping list.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great take away meals and groceries at a reasonable price
review_content:
While travelling with teens, we often find we need to keep food on hand! Fresh fruit, vegetables, unsweetened almond milk, and healthy take away meals - and lovely desserts - were easy to pick up right across from our hotel - the Quin. Morton Williams was open late with lots of staff to help, and they carry a great variety...
More

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:
I stayed in a hotel directly across the street. On my first night in, I landed late and didn't get to the hotel until after midnight. I hadn't eaten and needed a snack. This little grocery store is jam-packed with pre-made foods like sandwiches, salads, entrees. During the day there is a hot food bar. The drink selection is massive,...

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Everything you could need and more
review_content: This store stocks everything you could need and more. Excellent salad bar, plated meals, snacks, drinks and bakery. We brought something from here every day of our stay.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Great little market. We picked up bakery items and coffee one day and walked. The next morning we ate from the hot bar. It was good, inexpensive and the even have a place upstairs to eat.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

The pasta tends to be soggy, the soups very floury, and the baked good not all that fresh. It's really hit...

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great Place to Grab a Quick Bite
review_content: We ate a few breakfasts and dinners here along with buying water, snacks and beers here. Not too pricey for midtown, incredibly convenient and clean. Great choices on the hot bar and late at night. If you're in a hurry or short on cash, come here. Or if you're neither.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great spot with everything you need for the right price
review_content: This place has everything you need. Prepared food, beer and much more. Excellent quality and prices that are great if you want to supplement your $200+ dinners with reasonable breakfasts or lunches!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: This store opens 24 hours a day. At every hour you can shop for grocery, produce and choose from a variety of prepared food. There is also space to sit and eat a meal in the store. Reasonable prices.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: GREAT GOURMET TAKE OUT 24hours next to our hotel
review_content: WE could shop anytime of day or night, fine cheese, produce, a huge dinner buffet by the pound (which I didn't try) a bakery, candy store and nice grocery store, very upscale, really enjoyed having it next door

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: This grocery store has everything. There is a food bar with homemade selections for every time of day, and seating upstairs to eat as well. The produce looked fresh and plentiful, and there were many natural selections.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:
We stayed at the Hilton W. 57th right next door to this place and we were in there daily. restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: this was right opposite our hotel so very handy for buying late night dinners on the way back home. great selection of ready cooked meals and lovely fruit and veg also available. tried to keep away from the lovely pastries and failed miserably.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Whatever you want in one place
review_content: Excellent market! Great variety of fresh fruit, hot food, snacks, beverages. Delicious cakes and pastries Good prices. It's really tidy and clean. The staff is very kind.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

Their chef has a fundamental touch to his foods which I appreciate very much because...

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: What a great find - right across the road from our hotel in W57th Street and open 24/7! Lots of hot food choices, great fresh food - fruit, cheeses, breads, pastries. Only thing missing was a good coffee!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Amazing fresh food at reasonable prices
review_content: The hot food counter was amazing. Hot soups, stews, potatoes, rice, veg. All was fresh and replenished. Delicious fruit salads, fresh fruit and bakery. All under one roof.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

review_content:

It has an amazing variety of foods including fresh produce, meats and baked goods plus a large selection of...

review_content: we picked up basics, milk, iced coffee, cookies, snacks, 2 half gallons of pomegranite lemonade, and some hot food items to bring back to the hotel room, which cut down on food expenses while visiting the city.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great shop, Wonderful solution if visiting and wanting to cut your meal costs.

First let me say that the food is very good. We stayed in a nearby hotel with a microwave and fridge, so it was nice to be able to drop in and pick up a meal after a long day and just eat in our room. The pre-made meals are large portions, so we split them at times. We were...

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great Food, wide choices, fair prices

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: We ran into this place when looking for breakfast items. I found a yogurt parfait that was full and reasonably priced compared to other placed in the area.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Lovely fresh produce and open 24hours. We would buy freshly cut fruit salad every day to take back to our hotel. It also has grocery items. So yummy prepared meals that we could microwave in our hotel room. Dining area upstairs is clean and it has free wifi.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Good place to run by to get bottled drinks or fruit or even a meal. Seating area is upstairs. I hadn't eaten much while traveling, went by Morton Williams before heading to the hotel for the night and and had a fruit bowl - hit the spot. It is a New York grocery/deli/bakery/beverage store.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: A perfect food market ! Only about 100 meters from Our hotel ! Bakery, cold and warm food. Delicious fruit and a large selctions of almost everything you need !

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Great and accesible prices to eat
review_content: if yoou want to save a consdierable amount of bucks you should consider take a look at that place iteven offer free wifi

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Good fresh food and nice market for you to pick up some fresh foods. Friendly staff and albeit a bit pricey we've never been disappointed with selection or quality. Enjoy!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: We stayed at our hotel very close to this location and stopped in here a couple times for breakfast food and a couple hot meals. Buffet is sold by weight and they have some great tasty options!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: We stayed at the Viceroy on W. 57th St and Morton Williams was next door. Great coffee, open 24 hours. We had breakfast here on mornings we we were rushed to make time for waking tour. Beautiful store, good price....have everything!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: I live right around the corner so I shop here for essentials ONLY for the past 10 years. The prices consistently ring up for more than advertised. You must watch them like a hawk but I doubt most tourists do.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: This shop had a bufett selling breakfast, lunsj and dinnercourses. Lots of delicatesses and lot to choose from

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:
While staying at the Viceroy Hotel, my friend and I found it very convenient and easy on the wallet to simply go a couple doors down to the market and pick up a pre-made salad, a couple beers and enjoy it in the room. The selection of foods and beverages were wonderful. Also there are tables where you can also...
More

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Good prices and tasty food for people on a budget who don't want to eat junk all day on their trip. Too bad our hotel wasn't nearby, otherwise we would have entered for lunch regularly.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: We bought groceries for our week in nyc. The items downstairs were on the expensive side but the produce was very reasonable and we ate it all. Definitely worth stocking up at Morton Williams..

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Love popping in for a well presented sandwich, special juice and fabulous bakery. Morton Williams sprkles with cleanliness which is so very welcoming.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: If you are looking to grab a fast bite to eat stop by this grocery store and find many options. Large hot food section. The sushi was better than average, desert looks good but dry.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: great store to pick up a nice lunch / snack
review_content: HUGE assortment of nice sandwiches and wraps- since it is a grocery store - easy to grab a sweet or chips to go with it. Very nice staff. Great for a quick bite on the run.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Although a little expensive the choices are many from all kinds of foods, drinks, sweets, breads and much more, and worth the time to buy and eat from there than eat out.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: How very convenient and perfect to shop!
review_content: This marketplace a few doors down from where we stayed in NYC on 57 th street between 6 and 7th ave was perfect for pricing up fruits and simple supplemental foods. The staff is pleasant and very helpful.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Best supermarket range with fast food buffet convenience
review_content: Love the range of food offerings. Found the tomato soup too salty though. Otherwise the convenience is there and you have assurance of quality. I enjoyed the supermarket and the selections. Will always look out for this chain in future

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: New York is SO expensive so this was our little godsend for bottled water and the like. Morning pastries are delicious but I can't understand how some things are just ludicrously expensive and other things normal eg 1L water 99c - box of cereal over $5!

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_title: Best buffet I've eaten in a supermarket.
review_content:
After trudging through Greenwich village we suddenly developed a ridiculously huge apitie that needed quenching sharpish. We could not find anywhere or anything agreeable to eat so the Morton Williams supermarket was like a beacon of hope in an overwise hungry world. I went in expecting to grab a bag of crisps or a snack but was coerced to the...

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

review_content: Located near Carnegie Hall this cafe/supermarket allows you to purchase and enjoy prepared foods and beverages. It is not fancy but it is handy and reasonably priced for a quick snack or small meal. There are several nearby hotels and this would offer a good option for a budget breakfast, lunch or dinner.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: We stayed across the street and found Morton Williams convenient with lots of options. We got sandwiches, and desert to go. All items were very good and reasonably priced. Lots of variety and very polite staff.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: 24 hour opening.great variety with prepared sandwiches/ snacks& meals.coffee bar upstairs with free WiFi!

review_content: Great freash foods , take away dinners,soups, salads, fruits. whatever you want it's there. Huge variety

review_content: could not believe the variety of everything, just wanted a fruit juice and had a choice of dozens did not know where to start, great for breakfast, just put on your plate - scrambled eggs bacon sausage fruit etc etc and then pay by weight at the till, fantastic

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: The Deli/Supermarket is wonderful. Open 24 hrs. Opposite Salisbury Hotel. Wifi free upstairs. Wonderful choices of hot dishes and salads.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: ...i've been at Morton's many times expecially for Sushi's take away, very fresh ingredients and very reasonable prices. But basically they have all you need and most of all they're open even late at night. The quality of fruits is super. Recommended

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: If this place doesn't have what you are looking for - you don't need it! All types of food to suit everyone's taste.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

review_content: THEY CARRY A VERY GOOD LINE OF ITEMS. THIS IS ONE OF THE FEW FOOD store chains that utilizes its space so well. They carry a good line of products for busy Manhattanites. I like they way that they do things here.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

review_title: Our regular breakfast to go when staying at the Viceroy
review_content: Clean, good food, easily accessible. Great for breakfast or coffee on the go!! Always a good selection of fresh food to pick from.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content: Across the street from the Salisbury Hotel, Morton Williams has everything. We had some fruit, coffee, and delicious pastries. Convenient, huge variety of foods from around the world, interesting to even browse.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:

review_content: The Fresh Marketrplace on West 57th Street was great. Had everything you could want from cup of coffee to delicious gateaux & even hot cooked food. Reasonably priced for good food, great value for money.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

Biscotti & Dancing Deer Brownies!) and snacks which we ate in the stores 2nd floor casual sitting area (tables, TV, clean bathrooms). They also sell hot prepared foods and salads for take out - which you can eat...

review_content: This is a fantastic 24 hour grocery store with sushi, salads, gourmet meals, baked goods, along with usual supplies found in a grocery store. You could skip all the amazing NYC restaurants and still eat well just by stopping here.

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326

Open 24/7 this is a better option to pharmacies with better products, in my opinion. And though they might not have aisle after aisle of it, there are some candy and spirits as...
More

restaurant_address: 140 W 57th St, New York City, NY 10019-3326
review_content:
Morton Williams' was just down the street from our hotel and it became our go to quick dining spot. There is a place to eat upstairs and downstairs there is a buffet (open til 7 pm I think), fresh fruit, sandwiches....it is a mini-deluxe supermarket right on West 57th Street. Everything we ate here was good; sandwiches, veggies and the...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We were recommended this burger joint by the hotel and it was well worth the visit. The burgers were cooked to perfection and the portion sizes were just right. I had the Turkey Burger which was moist unlike many others I have tasted in the city. The restaurant gets very busy so get there early to guarantee a seat.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Little hotspot in the Eadt village. The Burgers are just in the right size for us. Meat, yes you taste the meat, is in great quality. Service, barman is in one persan and one cook, is managing the place flexible and souverain. Must be

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: you will find great burgers and great beers at this place. Really nice to find a place like this that isn't a chain in the centre of Manhattan. The only reason why this doesnt get 5* is because our waiter was a little bored - didnt really seem interested in serving us. Irrespective, I would still go again!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: The place was packed, but we didn't mind to sit at the bar. The burger was juice and hot. I ordered the garlic fries, which were awesome.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We both had a black iron burger and large chips to share. Burgers were juicy and just as we ordered when we were asked how we'd like them. Yum yum!! Amazing burger and our waiter was great with helping me choose a good beer because the one I wanted was sold out. Really good range of craft beers.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Took my nine year old daughter on surprise trip to New York.. parked the car and needed a quick bite before we hit the town and decided to give the dark and industrial spot a try. The food and atmosphere was any thing but dark... Super bright and fresh inside as was the food!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We went here as it is close to the Hilton Times Square where we stayed. Great burger. Menu offered good variety at reasonable prices. large portion.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Me and my girlfriend trough 5 months we spent in US tried every burger we could 20+ we ate all "best" burgers in NYC also, but this one was THE BEST by far. This was just amazing, everything was full of flavor witch is rarely found. Order anything i think you can't go wrong here!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: This restaurant was just around the corner from our hotel and we stumbled across it on our first night. We decided just to eat here so we wouldn't have to walk far and it was great. Fairly plain, simple food but tasty, wholesome and good value for money, you won't be disappointed.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We go here every time we're in town and it really is the best burger! The meat was cooked perfectly, so succulent and FULL of juice and flavour!! I could eat another one right now!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Great find for a late bite
review_content:
Stumbled onto this gem when the original place we were going had been closed for business-lucky for us! What a great place for an inexpensive GREAT late night meal! They have some great burgers to choose from, and a make your own option. Coupled with this is the awesome craft beer selection. The sweet potato fries are to die for!...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: The burgers were fantastic. Patty is the right size for the bun. Must have the burger with an egg. Service was slow but other then that is was good.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: I had lunch twice during my stay in New York. There is a wide selection of burgers and sides. I had the classic burger that was delicious. Staff is friendly and the place is very nice.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We had a absolutly great time with the best burgers and craftbeer in New York. We will go again as soon as possible. It's a small but unique place.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
I went with friends for a quick bite to eat. We all enjoyed our burgers and shared a couple sides. The loaded fries and sweet potato fries were both great. Service was wonderful, the staff was friendly and very attentive. I'd give this place a fifth star if the entrees came with sides and not ala carte, I am never...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: The right size for a buger
review_content: Would said that the size of the burger is right, meat flavor is great and the bun was yummy. I ate one of the flagship burgers and was enough. I also got the onions rings but it was to much for one person. I would probably repeat in the future and try a shake instead of onions.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: My favourite Black Iron Burger in the City
review_content: Cozy, homie and chill. Great service. It is a small place, perfect for a small group of friends or couples. Have a great time and cheers with a dark milk beer!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: One of the best burgers I've had in NYC. The fries were not good. I'm not sure if they undercooked them or what but they were limp and yucky. I'd go back for the burger many times!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: At our first night in NY, we ended up at this restaurant, starving for some food. We have been traveling all day long, and this restaurant was just around the corner from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and efficient with our ordering of food. The burger was very tasty. Great place as well, very rustic.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: best burger in the east village
review_content: Simple but comfortable pub-like room serves the best burger in the east village. Basic burger and beer joint that is easy to take, relaxing and provides a hearty, well-prepared burger.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Good Burger, fries and beer. What else do you need?
review_content:
We arrived by train at Penn Station and before heading downtown to our hotel, we decided to walk up to this place. We were feeling a bit tight on time, we always worry when we gave to drag our luggage into a restaurant. Not a worry at this place. It is a very narrow space that looked crowed at lunch...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Amazing beer! The burger was really tasty and the bacon crispy.the staff was nice and easy going!Fantastic atmosphere! 5 star!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We had nice food and beer here. I think its ok for the price. We had two burgers, and 4 beer and paid around $60-70. Service was really attentive and friendly. The burger have been good with the meat exactly how we ordered. We also liked the music - 3 doors doen and similar.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: So we stumbled on this place late at night needing food. Some of the best burgers we have ever had!!! Even the turkey burger was amazing. And get the cheese fries!!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
We found this place a little walk from Times Square and it was just what we were after - not too busy, dark lighting, good beer and big fat burgers. We watched the baseball whilst waiting for our food, and when the food came it was great. I had the Black Iron burger, delicious meat and plenty of sides to...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: One of the best burgers I have had in a long time.... definitely worth a visit to the east village just for this.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Maybe the best burger I've ever eaten. The best part is they don't mess with the meat; no filler, no spices, nothing but top quality lean beef. The menu has lots of unusal topping offerings with great flavor combinations. An eclectic list of beers you've never heard of keep it interesting. Typical New York atmosphere, loud and proud! Well worth...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: The best burger that I have ever had was the Little Italy Burger from this restaurant. It was so good, we returned a few days later.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
We came across this place by chance while we were on vacation and had a great meal there. We didn't sample many of the beers but they had a nice variety on draft and in bottles (loved seeing Abita on tap in New York!). The Black Iron burger was very good, the Hashbrown burger was a little heavy on the...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: This place has a very good selection of draft beer and is well worth stopping in to have a pint. The staff were friendly. According to the staff they had the best burger in NYC. It could have been better, only average. Stop in for a craft beer and pick something else from the menu.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We found this by chance. We had the double burger and the breakfast burger they were both delicious. We got the fries for an appetizer and they have you and ton. Great find.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Very enjoyable eating experience. Lucky to get seated on arrival as others who arrived a few minutes either had to wait for table. Staff very friendly & hospitable. All dishes we tried were excellent. Burgers cooked to perfection. Fries very tasty & onion rings delicious. Beer & cider really quenched the thirst. Has quite a variety of craft beers on...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Went here on the Saturday 27th Feb, we were looking to try somewhere close to the hotel. As a real ale lover I liked the choice of beer. I had a burger with some fries. it was good.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
took the family in to see the tree at rockefeller center during the holiday break; did the customary walk up 5th avenue to see the window displays (which were slightly disappointing this year& especially mad at Macys for taking apart their windows the weekend of new years day..really ..they couldn't wait until mon, jan 4th??) anyway we set off to...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Burgers taste... Like burgers to be honest. They are nice but nothing special. The service is not great (they forgot my extras but I was still charged for them) and the setting is noisy and full of sports on TV (which wasn't what I was expecting). It's basically a cheap sports bar, like Walkabout in the UK. Don't make a...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
The burgers were really good. The fries were also good, while the chili mayo was to die for. Really, really good. One plate of fries is enough for two. The service was terrible though. Unattentive, arrogant, annoying. Our waiter didn't bother to write down our orders - fair enough if you're able to remember it all. He wasn't though. We...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Great burgers and beers. Friendly cosy burger bar right across the street from where we were staying. Was always busy so had to give it a go and was not disappointed. Happy hour beers till 7pm as well.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: What a burger! Best burgers we've had in a long time! Great atmosphere, great selection of beers and the first draft cider I've found in NYC. Very happy! Would come back. Again and again and again and again! If I lived here this would be my local!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Having read review of this place on trip advisor I was keen to try it! The restaurant is in a quiet location in East Village. The staff were really helpful and friendly. We both had burgers and shared Cajun fries-all the food was delicious. The vanilla milkshake was particularly good and I would highly recommend you trying!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: One of the best burgers we've eaten
review_content:
Very simply the best meal we had in New York and our cheapest evening meal as well! We were keen on having burgers and found this place online. It was more of a walk from the metro than we realised but we didn't regret it all! The service was fantastic. I asked for a beer which they didn't have and...
More

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Easily the best burger I've had in NYC! Juicy and full of flavor for a very reasonable price. The service was great and speedy.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
My husband and I luckily stumbled into Black Iron. It was jam-packed but we soon learned why. Get the Black Iron. Honestly one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. We also got the yuca chips and guacamole which were great, too. And for the price! Less than any other meal we had in NYC. Close to Madison Square...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: My husband and I stopped here our first night in New York, and wow wow wow! I ordered the turkey burger. It was probably one of the best turkey burgers I have ever had. My husband ordered the burger that comes with a fried egg on top, and it was deli out. I highly recommend it!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Happened to walk by and see this place and decided to have dinner there and were very glad we did. Amazing selection of burgers of all varieties and all so good. Great selection of beer.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Fantastic burgers, great menu, great staff, great place
review_content:
Stopped in here for lunch with friends on a warm September Saturday and had a thoroughly excellent meal. The menu was simple but full of interesting ideas, the drinks list decent too although my first (fairly random) choice was not available. Alternatives were thoughtfully suggested and turned out to be excellent. I went for the Masterpiece burger which was delicious,...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: I found this restaurant on trip advisor and I am SO glad that I did. My family and I enjoyed our lunch. The burgers were delicious and I highly recommend the loaded fries.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: One of the best burgers I have ever had. Fast service. Small and narrow. It can get noisy. I would recommend reservations ahead of time.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: This spot has everything you need. It isn't highly rated by Zagat for no reason. Excellent service that isn't too pushy or needy, great food, great brews, and great location. I will definitely be back for the aptly named "Masterpiece" burger.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
This is a decent burger bar. The reason for the average rating is that we asked for well done burgers with no pink and got pink burgers. To their credit, they did apologize and recook the burgers right away. For a burger place, you'd expect they would know how to cook a well done burger. Once cooked properly, the burgers...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Nice choice for a burger in NYC!
review_content: My husband and I went here before a concert at MSG. Burgers were really good, fries were delicious, and service was efficient. Nice choice if you are looking for a pub type of restaurant and prices were very reasonable for NYC.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
I went to the location on 38th street. The service was some of the friendliest I've ever had. The service staff helped with menu suggestions. I had an excellent craft hard apple cider (McKenna's). The burger was great. Definitely not over priced for New York City. I would absolutely recommend. I had: Hashbrown burger, garlic fries, and hard apple cider....

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
We chanced across this burger joint as we can't read a map properly and got a little lost around lunchtime. restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Paid $60 bill on credit card. Also pending on my card was a $40 amount - this was showing on my card for 2 weeks, along with the $60 total. What were they doing? I can't see how this was an error considering they were completely different totals. Very dodgy, very suspicious. Completely unacceptable behaviour. Can only assume they have...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Whether looking for the all-time fav Black Iron or new tastes like Little Italy burger, you will not be disappointed. The meat is exactly cooked at tour best preference. The yuca fries are addictive!. Great food in friendly ambiente plus German beers I really recommend it!.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Excellent pub-style burgers with great atmosphere
review_content: You can choose your burger toppings or other type of dishes in this pub-style venue on7th avenue. Ours were excellent and the wine reasonably prices too. Good atmosphere too.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Food was excellent, service was excellent...well worth the trip!!! Great selection of food, not pricey at all...great local people watching place.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
I took my son here while we were traveling, and he still dreams about the burger he had here! I sent a picture of my son to his dad back home and all his dad could look at was the burger!!! It's crowded when there's something going on at MSG, but the staff are extremely friendly and the food is...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Travelling from Australia I was looking forward to the famous New York burgers. Black iron burger did not disappoint at all. Excellent burger- cooked to my wishes, along with some excellent fries with a mayo.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: BEEF, just the way you LOVE IT!
review_content: OMG, the burgers are off the charts! Horseradish mayo to dunk your thin crispy onion rings....YUMMY! Topped it off with a lovely IPA on tap. Best of all, no pretentious douchebags in this place....Great Eats, Cool Place, ....I'll be back!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
... highly over-hyped. The "best burger in NY" (Zagat 2015)? I don't think so. restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Great Burger and Beer in NYC
review_content: This highly Zagat and yelp burger bar lives up to the hype. I got the patty melt and my wife got the original burger with loaded fries to split and they were great. Top that with a NYC local brew and some Yankees baseball and you have a great night!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Dive bar burger sports bar! What's not to love!
review_content:
Staying locally we wanted a close-by amazing American burger joint. Repeatedly voted one of New Yorks best burgers we weren't disappointed. Simple menu of house choices or a pick and choose your own build, cooked as you prefer (the medium rare was extremely rare but we'd rather that than over done). One of the tastiest burgers we've ever had and...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Knew the place had potential from first glance, nice low lighting, buzzing mood and extremely tasty food, plus great service and good beer couldn't be happier!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Great burgers and a great beer choice. Nice friendly service and staff. However, restrooms were a mess and the mirrors down the whole side of one wall needed a good old fashioned clean. Shame.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: The best burger i ever had so far
review_content:
Honestly, im a burger lover, so every time i get the chance to try a new burger place i do it. So far this is the best one i ever had. The place itself is an old-fashioned small and cozy restaurant. In the menu you have variety of burgers but besides that, you can personalize it with all the ingredients...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Solid burger cooked to your liking. There is far more bun than necessary. Great wait staff with good service. A little pricey as you have to pay per ingredient on a classic burger.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Awesome place!! We had a great time, yummy burguers and great service! I heard they have others location, can't wait to visit them!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Out of the way, out of this world burger with a great beer selection and great service. Recommended by a friend and I would recommend in turn. What's not to like....perfect mix of bar and great food.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
I visited the location on 7th Ave - i wish I'd have kept walking in the rain. The burger was flavorless and smaller than advertised (though that may have been a good thing), the cheese was not melted. The garlic fries were OK - nothing special. The service was pleasant though sporadic. Not bad, but given the other choices in...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Came here for a post-Super Bowl burger and it was perfect. Good selection of beers, good service and v high quality burgers cooked as you request couldn't ask for anything more. Loved that you could build your own burger. Would recommend.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
This was our first stop for food on our recent trip to New York. We wanted somewhere relaxed enough to welcome two weary tourists straight off the plane, but which still served a great burger and a refreshing choice of beers. This place didn't disappoint. We went to the Midtown location. It's a small but cosy venue with a reassuring...

review_content:
We visited the Times Square location and the food was fantastic. We used a Groupon and they did not make it complicated. There were limited options to use the Groupon for that I wish they indicated on the Groupon itself but overall it was enough choice for us. The food was delicious and the service was very good. restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: We had an early dinner to beat the crowds. W 38th was convenient to Penn Station. the burgers and shoestring fries were great, son had loaded fries that he loved. Service was fine, the host and waitress were very friendly and attentive.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Although very busy, service was fast and friendly. Small restaurant with a true New york vibe. Prices are good, food even better.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Place is crowded and cramped but the burgers are the reason why. Love the "masterpiece". Expect to wait, but it's worth it.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Was late for a music rehearsal, So it was an eat and run kind of a situation. I stopped at the one on W38th between 7th & 8th Not only was the burger perfect, they got me out so fast so that I was able to make the session. I felt guilty in rushing them and told them how bad...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Me and my family had a late lunch on sunny weekend, They have two locations in the City,and we dined at a theatre district,which are recently opened. At 13:30,some family and couple customers there. Servers are friendly and kind. We ordered as follow: Me "the master piece burger with French fry,well- done" My husband " the Italian burger with onion...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: This place is small and you would walk right by if you didn't know it was there, but don't pass it up. Just a few blocks from Madison Square Garden. The food was delicious and service friendly. Burgers, fries, onion rings, guacamole and drinks were amazing and for the price you can't beat it. I can't wait to go back!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Its the best burger in New York for me. Its in a very good neighborhood and you can get there with F train. If you want a drink after your dinner there are a lot of bars in the area. I love masterpiece burger and loaded freenc fries. Onion rings is also good but if i choose, i'd choose loaded...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: You could easily walk past this place and not even know its there but it's well worth a visit. Had an excellent burger here.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content:
Ok, read some of the other reviews of this place which just opened up in the neighborhood (Garment District) so figured it was worth a shot. They do have another location on the eastside. Who can resist the lure of burger & beer especially when promoted as "Nobody Beats Our Meat." It's too bad that slogan really does not hold...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: I actually went to their pop-up restaurant on Broadway which is part of the Garment District open spaces project. Great burger for only £9 dollars, outstanding!

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Knew this was nearby to where we were and looking a bit lost a guy on the street stopped to help and took us to the door, and it was well worth it, great burgers well cooked and fab onion rings, all washed down with a good selection of biers. All at a very reasonable price.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: The service was great, quick, and the food was good, standard American fare. I was with a party of like 20, things came quick, and my burger was replaced in like five minutes when it came with red pepper (allergy). Bah! It's a nice pub, with four dollar beers, and a friendly and apt wait staff.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: The burgers are really great! I loved the fries and other sides as well. We used a groupon and got two beers with our burgers. Was a good meal for the weekday, especially because it wasn't crowded.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Everything was amazing! from food to service. Will definately come back!
review_content:
We went to this burger shop because it was very close to where we were staying. The minute we stepped foot in it was amazing!- From the décor of the place to the great smell of burgers. My husband ordered the masterpiece, and boy it is indeed a masterpiece! the combination of swiss and grilled onion plus an organic egg...
