review_title: Nice Burgers and Venue but be careful of the Groupon Deal
review_content:
We visited Black Iron Burger in January and enjoyed it so much when we saw a group on deal we went back in May. The Burger was good as were the sides and beer and our $20 deal included these, what it didn't include was the 20% service charge which was added to whole value of our meal (and not...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Nicely done burgers and cold beer in a cozy but crowded space. The burgers were cooked exactly as ordered which is not always how other places do it. Nice selection of beer and good service all add up to a good experience.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Perfect place for a reasonably priced burger.
review_content:
Although this might be a little off the beatin' path I found this place to be just what I wanted for lunch. Good craft beer, uncomplicated menu, great little atmosphere with good music playing in the background. As someone else already said this is a bar that makes burgers and that's about it. Flavorful, cooked just the way you asked...

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: This place is worth the visit!! The Black Ïron Burger, the new seasoned wings, Yuca Chips & Guacamole, the Onion Rings... everything is fresh and homemade!! Great beer selection too, My favorite burger joint in the city.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_title: Fun place. Pretty good burgers and beer
review_content: I'd go back to this place. Small and cosy. Great burgers. Good craft beer menu. Just burgers. Just beer. Best for a small group.

restaurant_address: 540 E 5th Street, Between Ave. A and B, New York City, NY
review_content: Big, meaty, juicy, never over-cooked, and always flavorful. It is right in the middle price wise, but it is by far one of the best burgers in the city. Great beer selection too!

The interior just says "Steakhouse". I dined at the Bar with the rest of the business crowd. The Bartender was friendly and...

review_content:
I happened by this highly regarded New York steak house in search for a place for dinner for me and my spouse. Before I checked out the regular menu, with its more usual steak house favorites, I noticed a sandwich board with Uncle Jack's fall specials, ranging in price from $32 to $38 for an entree. restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Nice setting and very friendly staff. Good price for 10oz fillet ($39) and cooked to perfection. Had the biggest broccoli side dish along with jumbo sized steak fries ( this would cover 3 people easily). Not the best steaks I have ever had but well worth for the friendly staff, good atmosphere and a nice experience.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_title: Prime aged rib chop not so prime

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Very good ambience, attentive waiters, simple steaks and vegetables all extremely well cooked. Expensive but worth it!

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content:

review_content: On entry to Uncle Jacks you are made to feel special. I will keep this short - Superb Service, Superb Food, Superb Restaurant. Willie should be proud of this place, We loved it xxx

review_title: Very good food, great staff, outdated atmosphere

review_content: Dined here on a recent business trip. Authentic atmosphere of proper American steakhouse. Excellent service, good deal on a more expensive bottle of wine when our first two choices were it available and delicious steak

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: My wife and I popped into this restaurant after a tiring day walking around NYC. We sat at the bar and had a drink with some very friendly locals before being seated. The staff were helpful (especially the barman) and the food excellent. It's not cheap but you get what you pay for.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: This place is the of the most romantic restaurants I have visited. They have the best steak I've ever had (yes better then Wolfgang's and smith and wollensky). This is place isn't cheap but with great service, amazing atmosphere Highly recommended

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Loved loved loved the steak here! The food was fantastic!! Everything is ala carte and served family style so be sure to share!! The steak was thick and juicy and aged to perfection! The service was impeccable! Staff was very friendly!! New favorite steak place in NYC!!

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Service was impeccable. While pricey, you get what you pay for. It was well worth it. My steak was outstanding. I would go back there in a heart beat.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Went here on a groupon. We were treated very well considering the relatively cheaper price we paid. Service To our table. Drinks great food good service so so. I would give it a second chance if I could get another groupon.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: This place was perfect for a couple looking for a great place to eat. Fairly priced, great size servings and awesome service.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: We came here while in NY for my husbands 40th birthday and the food was fantastic. The steaks are cooked and seasoned to perfection and are unbeatable. The waiting staff were extremely attentive and made us feel special, even bringing a cake at no extra charge. I would strongly recommend people to visit uncle jacks when in Manhattan.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Great atmosphere in old time steakhouse. Food was good, not great and pretty pricey. Overall it was a good experience, waitstaff and bar staff were both fantastic.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: There is so much "right" about Uncle Jack's it's a shame the steaks (on two occasions) were so very over-salted in the kitchen. As I said, the restaurant is worth visiting BUT if you like steak and not salt be SURE to have your waiter instruct the kitchen to put down the shaker.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019

review_content: Uncle Jack's was a step above Sparks. I ordered the New York strip very nice cut, cooked very good but not great. Service was a step below Sparks. Sides were outstanding could not stop eating the Mac n cheese. Dessert's definitely needs to be improved.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Steaks were outstandingly chosen, aged, prepared, and served in a timely and professional manner! Service from the owner, the captain, and servers were remarkable! Couldn't be better! What an event!

review_content: Nothing special..had a groupon to use and the food was eh..not bad but nothing to write home about.. decent steak but definitely better steak house out there. Service was great and decor was lovely.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: Went to Uncle jacks after our wedding on Gapstow Bridge ( Central Park). It was within walking distance although we managed to get the limo from The Plaza hotel to take us for free :). Anyway steaks were 1st class and the service also. Great day and meal.

restaurant_address: 44 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
review_content: The porterhouse steak at Uncle Jack's was sooooooo good. We also had the steam broccoli, mashed potatoes with bacon added, as suggested by our waiter. The broccoli was excellent. We were not disappointed by any of the food; even the breads in the bread basket were delicious. The service was great. Uncle Jack's definitely gives Peter Luger's some competition!

review_content: We went to this restaurant on a group on certificate to see if we would like it. The food was very good. Service was efficient, but the restaurant had not ambiance. It was in a very touristy area, which was ok, but something did not feel like I was in a steak house.

Other than those two minor things the experience was great.

review_title: Great Service and even better food!!
review_content: Had a table upstairs with a group from work. Service was top notch, very attentive to every ask and detail. I had the Fred Flintstone Ribeye. 28oz of pure deliciousness!! Lobster Mac n Cheese also awesome. Going back for sure.
